t: Mark 1
John the Baptist Prepares the Way
The*p beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
As it is written in the Prophets: “Behold,*pn I send My messenger before Your face, Who*ld will prepare Your way before You.”
“The*ld voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare*ld the way of the Lord;*sb Make*ld His paths straight.’”
John*p came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
Then all the land of Judea, and those from Jerusalem, went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
Now*p John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
And he preached, saying, “There comes One after me who is mightier than I, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loose.
I indeed baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
John Baptizes Jesus
It*p came to pass in those days that*i Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
And immediately, coming up from the water, He saw the heavens parting and the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove.
Then a voice came from heaven, “You are My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
Satan Tempts Jesus
Immediately*p the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness.
And He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to Him.

Now*p after John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
and saying, “The*r time*r is*r fulfilled,*r and*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r at*r hand.*r Repent,*r and*r believe*r in*r the*r gospel.”*r
Four Fishermen Called as Disciples
And*p as He walked by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
Then Jesus said to them, “Follow*r Me,*r and*r I*r will*r make*r you*r become*r fishers*r of*r men.”*r

When*p He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son*i of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were*i in the boat mending their nets.
And immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after Him.
Jesus Casts Out an Unclean Spirit
Then*p they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught.
And they were astonished at His teaching, for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
Now*p there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he cried out,
saying, “Let us*i alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
But*p Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be*r quiet,*r and*r come*r out*r of*r him!”*r
And when the unclean spirit had convulsed him and cried out with a loud voice, he came out of him.

And immediately His fame spread throughout all the region around Galilee.
Peter’s Mother-in-Law Healed
Now*p as soon as they had come out of the synagogue, they entered the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and they told Him about her at once.
So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she served them.
Many Healed After Sabbath Sunset
At*p evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were demon-possessed.
And the whole city was gathered together at the door.
Then He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He did not allow the demons to speak, because they knew Him.
Preaching in Galilee
Now*p in the morning, having risen a long while before daylight, He went out and departed to a solitary place; and there He prayed.
And Simon and those who*i were*i with Him searched for Him.
When they found Him, they said to Him, “Everyone is looking for You.”
But*p He said to them, “Let*r us*r go*r into*r the*r next*r towns,*r that*r I*r may*r preach*r there*r also,*r because*r for*r this*r purpose*r I*r have*r come*r forth.”*r
And*p He was preaching in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and casting out demons.
Jesus Cleanses a Leper
Now*p a leper came to Him, imploring Him, kneeling down to Him and saying to Him, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Then*p Jesus, moved with compassion, stretched out His*i hand and touched him, and said to him, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r

And He strictly warned him and sent him away at once,

and said to him, “See*r that*r you*r say*r nothing*r to*r anyone;*r but*r go*r your*r way,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r for*r your*r cleansing*r those*r things*r which*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r

However,*p he went out and began to proclaim it*i freely, and to spread the matter, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter the city, but was outside in deserted places; and they came to Him from every direction.
Mark 2
Jesus Forgives and Heals a Paralytic

Then they came to Him, bringing a paralytic who was carried by four men.*i
And when they could not come near Him because of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where He was. So when they had broken through, they let down the bed on which the paralytic was lying.
When*p Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r you.”*r

But*p immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they reasoned thus within themselves, He said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r reason*r about*r these*r things*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier,*r to*r say*r to*r the*r paralytic,*r ‘Your*ir sins*r are*r forgiven*r you,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Arise,*r take*r up*r your*r bed*r and*r walk’?*r

Matthew the Tax Collector
Then*p He went out again by the sea; and all the multitude came to Him, and He taught them.

When*p Jesus heard it,*i He said to them, “Those*r who*r are*r well*r have*r no*r need*r of*r a*r physician,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r I*r did*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*ir righteous,*r but*r sinners,*r to*r repentance.”*r
Jesus Is Questioned About Fasting
The*p disciples of John and of the Pharisees were fasting. Then they came and said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”

And*p Jesus said to them, “Can*r the*r friends*r of*r the*r bridegroom*r fast*r while*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them?*r As*r long*r as*r they*r have*r the*r bridegroom*r with*r them*r they*r cannot*r fast.*r
But*r the*r days*r will*r come*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r they*r will*r fast*r in*r those*r days.*r

Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath

But*p He said to them, “Have*r you*r never*r read*r what*r David*r did*r when*r he*r was*r in*r need*r and*r hungry,*r he*r and*r those*r with*r him:*r

And*p He said to them, “The*r Sabbath*r was*r made*r for*r man,*r and*r not*r man*r for*r the*r Sabbath.*r

Mark 3
Healing on the Sabbath
And*p He entered the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a withered hand.
So they watched Him closely, whether He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.
And He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Step*r forward.”*r
Then He said to them, “Is*r it*r lawful*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r to*r do*r good*r or*r to*r do*r evil,*r to*r save*r life*r or*r to*r kill?”*r But they kept silent.

And when He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved by the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, “Stretch*r out*r your*r hand.”*r And he stretched it*i out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
Then the Pharisees went out and immediately plotted with the Herodians against Him, how they might destroy Him.
A Great Multitude Follows Jesus
But*p Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea. And a great multitude from Galilee followed Him, and from Judea
and Jerusalem and Idumea and beyond the Jordan; and those from Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they heard how many things He was doing, came to Him.
So He told His disciples that a small boat should be kept ready for Him because of the multitude, lest they should crush Him.
For He healed many, so that as many as had afflictions pressed about Him to touch Him.
And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw Him, fell down before Him and cried out, saying, “You are the Son of God.”
But He sternly warned them that they should not make Him known.
The Twelve Apostles
And*p He went up on the mountain and called to Him*i those He Himself wanted. And they came to Him.

A House Divided Cannot Stand
Then*p the multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
But when His own people heard about*i this,*i they went out to lay hold of Him, for they said, “He is out of His mind.”

Mark 4
The Parable of the Sower
And*p again He began to teach by the sea. And a great multitude was gathered to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat in*i it*i on the sea; and the whole multitude was on the land facing the sea.

And*r it*r happened,*r as*r he*r sowed,*r that*ir some*r seed*ir fell*r by*r the*r wayside;*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r came*r and*r devoured*r it.*r

Jesus’ Use of Parables
And*p with many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.*i

Wind and Wave Obey Jesus
On*p the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, “Let*r us*r cross*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side.”*r

Then*p He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace,*r be*r still!”*r And the wind ceased and there was a great calm.

Mark 5
A Demon-Possessed Man Healed
Then*p they came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gadarenes.
And when He had come out of the boat, immediately there met Him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
who had his*i dwelling among the tombs; and no one could bind him, not even with chains,
because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. And the chains had been pulled apart by him, and the shackles broken in pieces; neither could anyone tame him.

Then He asked him, “What*r is*ir your*r name?”*r And*p he answered, saying, “My name is*i Legion; for we are many.”

And at once Jesus gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits went out and entered the swine (there were about two thousand); and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and drowned in the sea.
So*p those who fed the swine fled, and they told it*i in the city and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that had happened.

A Girl Restored to Life and a Woman Healed
Now*p when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, a great multitude gathered to Him; and He was by the sea.
And behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue came, Jairus by name. And when he saw Him, he fell at His feet
and begged Him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter lies at the point of death. Come and lay Your hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live.”
So Jesus*i went with him, and a great multitude followed Him and thronged Him.
Now*p a certain woman had a flow of blood for twelve years,
and had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was no better, but rather grew worse.
When she heard about Jesus, she came behind Him*i in the crowd and touched His garment.

While*p He was still speaking, some*i came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house*i who said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”
